title: Inlay Profile Head
description:
Inlay profile head of red quartzite facing right, representing Akhenaten or Smenkhare, probably the former.  Lips painted red.

Condition: Nose chipped. Eye, eyebrow and cheek slightly chipped. Minor scars. Lips painted red.
credit_line: Gift of the Egypt Exploration Society

museum_location.name: Amarna Period, Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Gallery, 3rd Floor

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: Composite sculpture, or sculpture that combines separately carved elements of different materials, became particularly popular during the Amarna Period. The face in profile was once embellished with the eye and eyebrow inlays made of glass or semiprecious stones. The crown as well as the rest of the body would have been carved from other stones.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
